alert.note: Alert for Central Panhandle Mountains (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued November 26 at 3:32AM MST until November 27 at 11:00PM MST by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WATCH IN EFFECT EARLY SUNDAY MORNING THROUGH SUNDAY EVENING... ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IS CANCELLED... * WHAT...Snow has ended across the central ID Panhandle mountains for today. Heavy snow is possible starting early Sunday morning and continuing through the day. Total snow accumulations of 1 to 2 inches in the valleys and 4 to 7 inches in the mountains is possible. * WHERE...Fourth Of July Pass, Pinehurst, St. Maries, Kellogg, Lookout Pass, Mullan, Wallace, Dobson Pass, Fernwood, and Osburn. * WHEN...From early Sunday morning through Sunday evening. * IMPACTS...Roads, and especially bridges and overpasses, will likely become slick and hazardous. Travel could be difficult.
info.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.
